page.title: 08Biography Mr. Adlam
page.content: Mr. Adlam is a well known local man who is a mine of information on a range of subjects. His family have lived in Fyfield for seventy years. They came from Elstead in Sussex. Mr. Adlam likes Fyfield because of the nature of the countryside. There are plenty of hedges, trees and wildlife. Mr. Adlam has owned, and his father before him, a nursery. He has done many jobs including being a plant inspector for Marks and Spencer. Mr. Adlam is able to identify the Fyfield Pea and lists it as his favourite flower. Mr. and Mrs. Adlam live in a bungalow which they have built themselves. Moorhens, Reed Warblers, Kestrel, partridges, pheasants and Magpies visit their garden. There is a garden pond in which live frogs, newts, tadpoles, water boatmen and freshwater shrimps.
